subSubSection.paragraph:
The genus
Diatrype
was introduced by Fries (1849). The genus is characterised by stromata widely effuse or verrucose, flat or slightly convex, with discoid or sulcate ostioles at the surface, 8-spored and long-stalked asci and hyaline or brownish, allantoid ascospores. In this study, we introduce a new species of
Diatrype
from China.
